questions.question: Can we identify an important health issue of our audience?

params.text: Match With Clientele
Identifying an Important Health Issue
Prioritizing Needs
Consider broadening the range of individuals you serve or the geographic area you serve in order to build your audience.

questions.question: Can we identify which programs are evidence-based?

params.text: What Does it Mean for a Program to be Evidence-Based?
Identifying Evidence-Based Programs
Visit the websites of the registries and databases provided as examples. Study the criteria these registries and databases use to certify EBPs.

questions.question: Does organizational leadership and staff support the program?

params.text: Support from Organizational Stakeholders and Presence of Program Champions
Present to your organization's leaders and/or staff the positive outcomes identified in the evaluation studies conducted on the EBP you would like to implement.

questions.question: Do we have a program champion?

params.text: Support from Organizational Stakeholders and Presence of Program Champions
Identify an individual (staff member or volunteer) who strongly believes in the program you would like to implement. Invite him or her to join you in advocating for the program.

questions.question: Do we have the personnel to implement the program?

params.text: Match With Organizational Resources
Establishing Partnerships
Identify organizations that have the personnel needed for the program and approach these organizations about partnership formation.
Recruit volunteers with the skills or credentials needed to implement the program.

questions.question: Do we have the facilities and equipment to implement the program?

params.text: Match With Organizational Resources
Establishing Partnerships
Identify organizations that have the resources needed for the program and approach these organizations about partnership formation.
Obtaining Funding
Seek additional funding from the sources listed as examples.

questions.question: Do we have the funding to implement the program?

params.text: Obtaining Funding
Seek additional funding from the sources listed as examples.
Establishing Partnerships
Identify organizations that you could partner with in order to decrease your funding needs. Approach these organizations about partnership formation.

questions.question: Are we willing to implement the EBP as designed?

params.text: Congratulations! The conditions in your organization are favorable for the successful implementation of an EBP.
What Does it Mean for a Program to be Evidence-Based?
Implementing Evidence-Based Programs with Fidelity
Adapting Programs to Local Needs and Preferences while Maintaining Fidelity
If you believe you will need to adapt a program, contact the developers to see if they will help you modify it.
